bioghist.p: Morris Jastrow, Jr. (1861-1921) was born in Warsaw, came to Philadelphia in 1866, and graduated from the University of Pennsylvania in 1881. He received a Ph.D. from Leipsic in 1884. He was a professor of Semitic languages (1893-1921) and librarian (1898-1921) at Penn. He published a number of books and was the editor of the Semitic department of the International Encyclopaedia. He was the son of the renowned Talmudic scholar Marcus Jastrow.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a series of manuscripts of lectures written by Morris Jastrow. The lectures are on the the origins and contents of the Talmud, on Hebrew festivals, and Jewish worship and sacrifice. The manuscripts are undated.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
